doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 5/26/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 5/26/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Joyce Hunter, and Christopher Lynn, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund2. Discussion of the lawsuit against Governor Cuomo's "anti-sex guidelines"3. Discussion of gay activism against anti-gay politicians and finding allies in politicsCOMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser4. Balancing sex education and AIDS education for children and young adultsCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund5. Andy Humm on politicians advocating abstinence to counter AIDS6. News Watch, CDC adds dementia and emaciation to AIDS symptoms7. Holland, upscale condom boutique opens on outskirts of Amsterdam's red light district8. Smoking found to possibly cause impotence9. A Florida man goes on a shooting rampage because he believed that some people thought he was gayCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine10. Sports ReportCOMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser11. Lavender Health, Ron Vauchon with Ellen Zaltzberg discussing various conferences centered around gay health issues12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Show Bits with George Trahanis, interview with Bob Bowyer of the off-Broadway show, "Funny Feet"COMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Olivia Negron interviews Karen Abbott and Bob Werner, two activists who placed pro-gay stickers around "Heritage USA," the park owned by Tammy Faye and Jim BakkerCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine3. Interview with Joe di Sabito about condom companies avoiding advertising in gay mediaCOMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser4. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with Mark Thompson, author and cultural editor of "The Advocate" magazine
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 22 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 5/26/1987]: May 1987
